reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Investing for impact against Tuberculosis and HIV

description.narrative: South Africa - TB/HIV - AIDS Foundation South Africa - AFSA. This program has the following goals: Accelerate prevention to reduce new HIV and TB infections and STIs. Reduce morbidity and mortality by providing treatment, care and adherence support for all. Reach all key and vulnerable populations with customised and targeted interventions. Address the social and structural drivers of HIV, TB and STIs, and lin these effort to the National Development Plan. Ground the response to HIV, TB and STIs in human rights principles and approaches. Promote leadership and shared accountability for sustainable response to HIV, TB and STIs. Mobilise resources and maximise efficiencies to support the achievment of NSP goals and ensure a sustainable approach. Strengthen strategic information to drive progress towards achievement of NSP goals. The objectives of this program are: 1.1 Reduce new HIV infections to less than 100,000 by 2022 through combination prevention interventions. 2.1 Implement the 90-90-90 strategy for HIV. 2.2 Implement the 90-90-90 Strategy for TB. 3.1 Increase engagment, collaboration and advocacy of key and vulnerable populations in the development and implementation of social and health support activities. 3.2 To provide an enabling environment to increase access to health services by key and vulnerable populations. 4.1 Implement social and behaviour change programmes to address key drivers of the epidemic and build social cohesion. 4.4 Implement and scale up a package of harm reduction interventions for harmful use of alcohol and drugs in all districts. 4.5 Implement economic strengthening programmes with a focus on youth in priority focus districts. 5.3 Promote an environment that enables and protects human and legal rights and prevents stigma and discrimination. 6.1 Strengthen AIDS Councils to provide effective co-ordination and leadership of all stakeholders for shared accountability in the implementation of the NSP. 7.1 Improve efficiency and mobilise sufficient resources to achieve the goals, objective and targets of the NSP. 8.1 Optimise routinely collected strategic health information for data utilisation in decision making

title.narrative: Coverage / Output indicator for ZAF-C-AFSA
Percentage of adolescent girls and young women (AGYW) using PrEP
Percentage of sex workers that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results
HR-Other 2: Number of analytical reports generated from a functional national human rights reporting system on human rights violations based on inputs from local level users
CSS-Other 1: Percentage of CSOs capacitated through the program that successfully attracted a small grant (any donor) and has begun implementation
HR-Other 1: Number of police and other law enforcement officers in Global Fund-supported districts reached by training program
YP-Other 1: Percentage of eligible other vulnerable populations who initiated oral antiretroviral PrEP during the reporting period
Percentage of other vulnerable populations that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results
Percentage of sex workers reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services
Percentage of other vulnerable populations reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services
Percentage of adolescent girls and young women (AGYW) reached with HIV prevention programs- defined package of services
Number of community based organizations that received a pre-defined package of training
Number of adolescent girls and young women (AGYW) who were tested for HIV and received their results during the reporting period
Percentage of eligible sex workers who initiated oral antiretroviral PrEP during the reporting period
KP Other-1: Number of male sexual partners that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results
Percentage of newly diagnosed people linked to HIV care (individual linkage)
CRS-Other 2: Percentage of MDIPs that include the needs and priorities of key and vulnerable populations (MSM, SW, AGYW and TG)
HR -Other 2: Number of analytical reports generated from a functional national HR reporting system on human rights violations based on inputs from local level users
Percentage of other vulnerable populations reached with HIV prevention programs - individual and/or smaller group level interventions
YP-other 1: Percentage of adolescents ( aged 15-24 years) attending TVET colleges who receive a standardised package of prevention programmes from trained peer educators
YP-Other 1: Number of male partners of AGYW who were tested for HIV and received their results during the reporting period
YP-other 2: Percentage of adolescents (aged 15-24 years) attending TVET colleges that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results
HIV-Other 2: Percentage of AGYW who receive economic strengthening based on an agreed package
CRS-Other 1: Percentage of CSO with capacity building plans implemented
Percentage of people newly diagnosed with HIV initiated on ART
Percentage of young people aged 10-24 years attending school reached by compehensive sexuality education and/or life skills-based HIV education in schools
HR-Other 1: Percentage of police in Global Fund-supported districts reached by training in diversity, dignity and police program
